topic.title: Adding Images to a DITA Topic

body.p: There are four ways to add images to a DITA topic, depending on if you want to create a figure (with title and caption) or just insert an image inline, and on whether you want to use different versions of a graphic in different media. (For instance, you might want to use a raster format such as PNG for Web output but a vector format such as EPS for print output.)
body.note: You must use a graphic format that is supported by the DITA output transforms (either those provided by the DITA Open Toolkit, or by third parties). Not all output transforms may support all the same media types. Consult the DITA documentation for information on which formats are supported.

ol.li: Place the caret in the position you want the graphic to be inserted.
Click the Insert Image Reference button . The Choose image dialog appears.

Either type in the URL of the image you want to insert or choose one of the insertion options provided by the button to the right of the URL: field. The following insertion options are available, each of which will allow you to select an image to enter:
Browser for local file: Opens the Open dialog to select a local file.
Browse for remote file: Opens the Open URL dialog to select a remote file.
Browse for archived file: Opens the Archive Browser to select a file from an archive.
Browse Data Source Explorer: Open the Data Source Explorer to select a file from a connected data source.
Search for file: Opens the Find Resource dialog to search for a file.

section.title: Adding an image in a figure
section.p: To add an image in a figure:

ol.li: Add a fig element to your document at the appropriate place.
Add a title and/or desc element to the fig element, according to your needs.
Add a image element to the fig element.

section.note: The fig element has a number of other child elements that may be appropriate to your content. See the DITA documentation for complete information on the fig element.

The order in which the image, title, and desc content are presented in output is determined by the output transform, not by the order in which they are entered in the source. If you want to change how they are output, you should modify the output transform, not your source content.

section.title: Adding an image using a key reference
section.p: The image element specifies a particular image file. You may have copies of your image in more than one format. You may wish to use a different format for different output types. One way to do this is to insert your image as a key reference. To use this approach:

ol.li: Create a DITA map to hold your image keys for each output media. For instance, you might create one map of images to be used in PDF and one for images to be used in Web output.
For each image in each map, create a topicref element with the following structure:<topicref keys="image.test" href="img/test.png" type="image">
Repeat in each map for each output type. For instance, in the map for PDF output create:<topicref keys="image.test" href="img/test.eps" type="image">
To insert an image by key, insert an image element and use a keyref attribute to point to the image.<image keyref="image.test"/>
Configure your build so that the appropriate image map is included for each output type.
